verses.verse: Who is as the wise<WH2450> man? and who knoweth<WH3045> the interpretation<WH6592> of a thing<WH1697>? a man's<WH120> wisdom<WH2451> maketh his face<WH6440> to shine<WH215>, and the boldness<WH5797> of his face<WH6440> shall be changed<WH8132>. the boldness: Heb. the strength
I counsel thee to keep<WH8104> the king's<WH4428> commandment<WH6310>, and that in regard<WH1700> of the oath<WH7621> of God<WH430>.
Be not hasty<WH926> to go out<WH3212> of his sight<WH6440>: stand<WH5975> not in an evil<WH7451> thing<WH1697>; for he doeth<WH6213> whatsoever pleaseth<WH2654> him.
Where the word<WH1697> of a king<WH4428> is, there is power<WH7983>: and who may say<WH559> unto him, What doest<WH6213> thou?

Whoso keepeth<WH8104> the commandment<WH4687> shall feel<WH3045> no evil<WH7451> thing<WH1697>: and a wise man's<WH2450> heart<WH3820> discerneth<WH3045> both time<WH6256> and judgment<WH4941>. shall: Heb. shall know
Because to every purpose<WH2656> there is<WH3426> time<WH6256> and judgment<WH4941>, therefore the misery<WH7451> of man<WH120> is great<WH7227> upon him.
For he knoweth<WH3045> not that which shall be: for who can tell<WH5046> him when it shall be? when: or, how it shall be?

There is no man<WH120> that hath power<WH7989> over the spirit<WH7307> to retain<WH3607> the spirit<WH7307>; neither hath he power<WH7983> in the day<WH3117> of death<WH4194>: and there is no discharge<WH4917> in that war<WH4421>; neither shall wickedness<WH7562> deliver<WH4422> those that are given<WH1167> to it. discharge: or, casting off weapons

All this have I seen<WH7200>, and applied<WH5414> my heart<WH3820> unto every work<WH4639> that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>: there is a time<WH6256> wherein one man<WH120> ruleth<WH7980> over another to his own hurt<WH7451>.

And so<WH3651> I saw<WH7200> the wicked<WH7563> buried<WH6912>, who had come<WH935> and gone<WH1980> from the place<WH4725> of the holy<WH6918>, and they were forgotten<WH7911> in the city<WH5892> where they had so done<WH6213>: this is also vanity<WH1892>.

Because sentence<WH6599> against an evil<WH7451> work<WH4639> is not executed<WH6213> speedily<WH4120>, therefore the heart<WH3820> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> is fully set<WH4390> in them to do<WH6213> evil<WH7451>.

Though a sinner<WH2398> do<WH6213> evil<WH7451> an hundred times<WH3967>, and his days be prolonged<WH748>, yet surely I know<WH3045> that it shall be well<WH2896> with them that fear<WH3373> God<WH430>, which fear<WH3372> before<WH6440> him:
But it shall not be well<WH2896> with the wicked<WH7563>, neither shall he prolong<WH748> his days<WH3117>, which are as a shadow<WH6738>; because he feareth<WH3373> not before<WH6440> God<WH430>.

There is<WH3426> a vanity<WH1892> which is done<WH6213> upon the earth<WH776>; that there be just<WH6662> men, unto whom it happeneth<WH5060> according to the work<WH4639> of the wicked<WH7563>; again, there be<WH3426> wicked<WH7563> men, to whom it happeneth<WH5060> according to the work<WH4639> of the righteous<WH6662>: I said<WH559> that this also<WH1571> is vanity<WH1892>.

Then I commended<WH7623> mirth<WH8057>, because a man<WH120> hath no better thing<WH2896> under the sun<WH8121>, than to eat<WH398>, and to drink<WH8354>, and to be merry<WH8055>: for that shall abide<WH3867> with him of his labour<WH5999> the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416>, which God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> him under the sun<WH8121>.

When I applied<WH5414> mine heart<WH3820> to know<WH3045> wisdom<WH2451>, and to see<WH7200> the business<WH6045> that is done<WH6213> upon the earth<WH776>: (for also there is that neither day<WH3117> nor night<WH3915> seeth<WH7200> sleep<WH8142> with his eyes<WH5869>:)

Then I beheld<WH7200> all the work<WH4639> of God<WH430>, that a man<WH120> cannot<WH3201> find out<WH4672> the work<WH4639> that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>: because<WH834> though<WH7945> a man<WH120> labour<WH5998> to seek it out<WH1245>, yet he shall not find<WH4672> it; yea further; though a wise<WH2450> man think<WH559> to know<WH3045> it, yet shall he not be able<WH3201> to find<WH4672> it.
